Pre-Game Insights: Harambee Stars are searching for a win against the Indomitable Lions to move back top in Group J of the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations (AFCON) qualifiers.
Head coach Engin Firat expects a tough match but retains hope in his charges, that they have quality to get a good result away from home.
Firat believes the players have shown him they are ready for the assignment and builds confidence with how he has seen the team improve over time.
Firat has been boosted with the availability of striker Michael Olunga as well as defender Daniel Anyembe who both missed the first round of matches with injury and personal reasons respectively.
Centreback Joseph Okumu is back fully fit after picking injury during the game against Namibia, and hasn’t played since.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cameroon have a potent squad, with goalkeeper Andre Onana leading them from the back.
Bryan Mbeumo (Brentford) and Carlos Baleba have also had great starts with Brentford and Brighton respectively in the English Premier League.
Playing at home with full support, Stars expect a hostile environment but will be all out for success.
Others: The match is scheduled to take place at the Stade Omnisport Ahmadou Ahidjo in Yaoundé on Friday night.
